intro: Leperiza urceolata, commonly known as the urn-shaped liverwort, is a small, non-vascular plant belonging to the family Marchantiaceae. It is characterized by its thalloid structure, which is typically lobed and resembles an urn in shape, hence its common name. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rocky crevices or on decaying wood. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, are simple and consist of a capsule that releases spores. Leperiza urceolata plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
